sols_html:
This requires us to find a point on the line and its slope.

When \(x=1\), \(\ln x = 0\) so we know the point \((1,0)\) is on the line.

If \(y = \ln x\) then \(\frac{dy}{dx} = \frac{1}{x}\) and \(\frac{dy}{dx}|_{x=1} = 1\) so the slope of the line is \(1\).

The equation of the tangent line is then \(y - 0 = 1(x-1)\), by the point-slope formula, or \(y = x-1\).
